alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 12:16PM CDT until July 29 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM CDT FOR WESTERN RANDOLPH...CHARITON...LINN...GRUNDY...WESTERN SULLIVAN... SOUTHERN MERCER...SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN HOWARD... NORTHEASTERN SALINE...SOUTHWESTERN MACON AND EASTERN LIVINGSTON COUNTIES... At 1215 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cainsville to near Linneus to near Keytesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Brookfield, Fayette, Marceline, Milan, Slater, Salisbury, Glasgow, Princeton, Brunswick, Keytesville, Bucklin, Ridgeway, Meadville, Gilman City, Laclede, Armstrong, Linneus, Wheeling and Browning. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
